question: Ðæt man linene claðas (wascan) #### — That man washed linen clothes
explanation: Here 'wascan' is in the third person singular past form 'wosc' because the subject is 'Ðæt man'

question: Hie heora hrægel (wascan) #### and clænsodon — They washed and cleansed their clothes
explanation: Here 'wascan' is in the third person singular past form 'wosc' because the subject is 'Ðæt man'

question: Þu (wascan) #### þas wyrte — You wash this plant
explanation: Here 'wascan' is in the second person singular form 'wæscst' because the subject is 'Þu'

question: Simon Petrus (dragan) #### ðæt nett on eorþe — Simon Petrus dragged the net ashore
explanation: Here 'dragan' is in the third person singular past form 'drog' because the subject is 'Simon'

question: Hie (dragan) #### heora scipa on, west—healfe ðære brycge — They dragged their ships to the west side of the bridge
explanation: Here 'dragan' is in the plural past form 'drogon' because the subject is 'Hie'

question: Þu (dragan) #### þin sweord ond þa fæmna þu ofsloge — You drew your sword and slayed the woman
explanation: Here 'dragan' is in the second person singular past form 'droge' because the subject is 'Þu'

question: His heafod hie (dragan) #### geond þa burh — They dragged his head through the town
explanation: Here 'dragan' is in the plural past form 'drogon' because the subject is 'Hie'

question: He me aðas (swerian) #### — He swore oaths to me
explanation: Here 'swerian' is in the third person singular past form 'swor' because the subject is 'He'

question: Hie (swerian) #### him betweonan, ðæt hig sibbe heoldon — They swore oaths between them that they would keep the peace
explanation: Here 'swerian' is in the plural past form 'swor' because the subject is 'Hie'

question: Swa swa ðu (swerian) #### on soðfæstnysse ðine — Just as you swore in your faithfulness
explanation: Here 'swerian' is in the second person singular past form 'swore' because the subject is 'ðu'

question: Ðu (ofersteppan) #### ðæm weall — You stepped over the wall
explanation: Here 'steppan' is in the second person singular past form 'stope' because the subject is 'ðu'

question: Hie (steppan) #### feondas swiðe mid fotum - They greatly trampled enemies with their feet
explanation: Here 'steppan' is in the plural past form 'stopon' because the subject is 'Hie'

question: Ða apostoli ða (hliehhan) #### ðæra deofla leasunga — The apostles then laughed at the devil's deception
explanation: Here 'hliehhan' is in the plural past form 'hlogon' because the subject is 'Ða apostoli'

question: (hliehhan) #### þa modi man — The bold man then laughed
explanation: Here 'hliehhan' is in the third person singular past form 'hlog' because the subject is 'þa modi man'

question: Ðonne þu (hliehhan) ####, þonne weop ic biterlice — When you laughed, then I wept bitterly
explanation: Here 'hliehhan' is in the second person singular past form 'hloge' because the subject is 'þu'

question: On ðam ilcan geare he (forþfaran) #### — In that same year he passed away
explanation: Here 'forþfaran' is in the third person singular past form 'forþfor' because the subject is 'he'

question: Hie (forþfaran) #### in þæm gefeohte — They died in that fight
explanation: Here 'forþfaran' is in the plural past form 'forþforon' because the subject is 'hie'

question: Hie (slean) #### fram eastsæ oð westsæ — They slaughtered from the east sea to the west sea
explanation: Here 'slean' is in the plural past form 'slogon' because the subject is 'Hie'

question: Nu þæt Iudeisce folc ðe Crist (slean) ####, secgað þæt hie willað gelifan on þone Fæder, and na on ðone Sunu ðe hiera magas slogon - Now the Jewish people who slew Christ, say that they will believe in the Father, and not in the Son whom their forefathers slew
explanation: Here 'slean' is in the plural past form 'slogon' because the subject is 'Iudeisce folc'

question: Sende he ða his cwelleras, and (slean) #### ealle ða hyse-cild þe wæron on þære byrig Bethleem - He then sent his executioners, and slew all the male children that were in the city of Bethlehem
explanation: Here 'slean' is in the third person singular past form 'sloh' because the subject is 'he'
